feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by subtracting them from the working days count. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control over calculation methodology.
To allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be configured to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
Super admin role and access to payroll settings configuration
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin role and access to payroll settings; if payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, those transactions must be rejected before saving new proration settings

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of public holidays in the month, and the leave policy type (calendar days or working days).

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and the deduction reflected on the payroll table.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that determine how daily deductions are applied to monthly employee pay
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on the selected calculation method; changes apply to all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Access Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure; 2. Select salary components for leave encashment (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances); 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days); 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select the required calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated as Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by the number of actual working days in the month. The leave policy can be based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation base options are limited to calendar days, working days, or custom days. Working days exclude weekends and public holidays from the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days allow flexibility to set calculation base according to company policies; most UAE and KSA companies set custom days as 30 to comply with labor law requirements.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; calculation methods available are Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days; configuration applies to eligible paid leave types
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes to salary proration affect all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the working days count when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working policy, the daily pay calculation must be based on 20 days (22 minus 2), not 22 days.

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation bases produce different daily wage rates and will impact final amounts for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration

Multiple configuration options are available for daily rate calculation, including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances methods, as well as three day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days), requiring careful selection based on organizational policy
When payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, Super admin must manually reject those transactions and resave the proration settings for changes to take effect

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management systems to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, the company's public holiday calendar configuration, and leave management systems to calculate accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction features.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar functionality exists in leave encashment configuration
Interacts with the Payroll system and payroll table; affects active payroll transactions and employee salary calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days: A leave policy based on total calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month). Working days: A leave policy based on business working days (e.g., 22 working days per month).

Calendar days: the total number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays configured in the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: a flexible calculation base that payroll managers can set according to company policies, commonly set to 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law.

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation; End-of-service: Final settlement calculations when an employee exits; Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: The method used to determine the daily deduction amount based on salary components; Leave encashment: Similar feature for calculating leave payouts

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): The payroll configuration feature for adjusting salary proration. Salary proration: The proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: The three methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days
